@danigray @Mamaofabean @ThePeriodPurse @Ptbo_Canada I think your point was misstated then. I know you are not saying that â€œlabels donâ€™t matterâ€ but rather what your post does covey is that labels matter (negatively) and we should avoid them/rethink them. I donâ€™t agree with this assertion.

@danigray @Mamaofabean @ThePeriodPurse @Ptbo_Canada Suggesting labels â€œarenâ€™t inclusive languageâ€ is your own veiled hang up. Labels can be both empowering and oppressive. I like this blog post much better as it does the subject of labels justice - minus the privilege lens. https://t.co/Yh5qE91r0B

@danigray @Mamaofabean @ThePeriodPurse @Ptbo_Canada I get what you attempted to say. But you did so by inferring labels were unnecessary. For some, labels form an important part of their identity. Next time instead of â€œmy advice is to refrain from being so quick to give everything a labelâ€ maybe just save your advice & embrace.
RT @peopleosophy: So, saying put a cherry on top, stamped it and no change backs doesnâ€™t work either? Aww man. #HRtweets #WellSaid ðŸ’ðŸ¤¯ httpsâ€¦

@danigray @Mamaofabean @ThePeriodPurse @Ptbo_Canada I see. So writing an entire blog post suggesting people need to drop labels (because it makes you uncomfy) is inclusive? Being inclusive means not telling anybody how to be / view themselves. Embracing them however they arrive is inclusivity. Know this.
This isnâ€™t even a fair question. https://t.co/6Uzs8S1YnJ

@danigray @Mamaofabean @ThePeriodPurse @Ptbo_Canada To me, labeling is not the issue. Inclusivity means embracing it all regardless. If we have to remove labels in order to be inclusive / see people as human, then this is a problem. Letâ€™s not be scared of labels people choose to use for themselves & focus instead on embracing.
